chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John T Lewis Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John T Lewis Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for John T Lewis Jr.  Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State. and request a resolution date. 
Defense  advised to the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing.


Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant John T Lewis in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant John T Lewis in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  John T Lewis appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Glendale Police Officer K. Fernandez. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with D.O.S. and B.M.W.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant John T Lewis in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant John T Lewis in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
